This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=AQUA-GENETICS.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-11T20:21:07Z Oliver Hooker 2015-03-11T20:20:36+00:00 2015-03-11T20:20:36+00:00 Advancing in 'R' statistics course https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AQUA-GENETICS;ca5bd288.1503 A repeat of the course titled 'ADVANCING IN R' has been scheduled for 30th November \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 4th December 2015<br><br>This course will provide an introduction to model selection and simplification, mixed effects models, generalised linear models and non-linear models<br><br>The content is designed to bridge the gap between basic R coding and more advanced statistical modelling whilst providing an overview of the most frequently used approaches to analysing data. [...] Oliver Hooker 2015-02-12T18:22:07+00:00 2015-02-12T18:22:07+00:00 Genetic data analysis using R - STATISTICS COURSE https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AQUA-GENETICS;606edbc3.1502 This 5 day course will be held at SCENE (Scottish Centre for Ecology and the Natural Environment), Glasgow, United Kingdom from August 3rd - 7th 2015<br><br>The course is being delivered by Dr. Thibaut Jombart who has contributed towards a number of R packages (adegenet, adephylo, geography, outbreaker, Outbreakertools, bmmix, episerve (author) and ade4 and phylobase (contributor) and Caitlin Collins (Imperial College London) who also contributes to the R packages adegenet, Outbreakertools and episerve) [...] Soledad De Esteban Trivigno 2014-11-24T10:40:08+01:00 2014-11-24T10:40:08+01:00 Course Introduction to Naturalistic and Scientific Illustration, May 18-22, Barcelona, Spain https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AQUA-GENETICS;b485401d.1411 Dear colleagues,<br><br>The second edition of the course "Introduction to Naturalistic and Scientific<br>Illustration" is open.<br><br>DATES: May 18-22, 2015.<br><br>Instructor: Oscar Sanisidro (Museo Nacional de Ciencias Naturales- CSIC, Spain).<br><br>Course webpage:<br>http://www.transmittingscience.org/courses/draw/scientific-illustration/<br><br>Site: Premises of Sabadell of the Institut Catal\ufffd\ufffd de Paleontologia Miquel<br>Crusafont (Barcelona, Spain).<br><br>PROGRAM:<br><br>- Scientific and naturalistic illustrations: Generalities and comparison.<br><br>- Scientific illustration versus photography. Webpage:<br>http://www.transmittingscience.org/courses/syst-bio/networks/<br><br>INSTRUCTORS: Dr. Diego Rasskin-Gutman (Institut Cavanilles de Biodiversitat i<br>Biologia Evolutiva, Spain) and Dr. Borja Esteve-Altava (Institut Cavanilles de<br>Biodiversitat i Biologia Evolutiva, Spain).<br><br>DATES: April, 20-24, 2015. 34 teaching hours.<br><br>PLACE: Facilities of the Centre de Restauraci\ufffd\ufffd i Interpretaci\ufffd\ufffd de Els Hostalets<br>de Pierola, Els hostalets de Pierola, Barcelona (Spain). Instructor: Dr. Melissa Tallman (Grand Valley State University, USA).<br><br>DATES: May 4-8, 2015.<br><br>PLACE: Facilities of the Centre of Restauraci\ufffd\ufffd i Interpretaci\ufffd\ufffd Paleontologica,<br>Els Hostalets de Pierola, Barcelona (Spain).<br><br>Course Website: http://www.transmittingscience.org/courses/gm/3d-gm/<br><br>The workshop is entitled to teach the main concepts of shape analysis based on<br>three-dimensional landmark coordinates. In this workshop we you will learn to<br>manipulate 3D models and use them to collect landmark data, take measurements,<br>and to quantify and visualize the main differences in shape. End early registration: October<br>31.<br><br>PLACE: Facilities of the Centre of Restauraci\ufffd\ufffd i Interpretaci\ufffd\ufffd Paleontologica,<br>Els Hostalets de Pierola, Barcelona (Spain). [...] Soledad De Esteban Trivigno 2014-08-05T12:09:51+02:00 2014-08-05T12:09:51+02:00 Course Phylogenetic Analysis, May 4-8 2015, Barcelona, Spain https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AQUA-GENETICS;10441ef5.1408 Dear Colleagues,<br><br>Registration is open for the course "AN INTRODUCTION TO PHYLOGENETICS ANALYSIS<br>USING R - Second Edition".<br><br>INSTRUCTORS: Dr. Emmanuel Paradis (Institut de Recherche pour le D\ufffd\ufffdveloppement,<br>France) and Dr. Klaus Schliep (Universidad de Vigo, Spain).<br><br>DATES: May 4-8, 2015<br><br>More information:<br>http://www.transmittingscience.org/courses/phylo/phylogeny-with-r/ or wrtiting<br>to courses@transmittingscience.org.<br><br>This course is for biologists dealing with the analysis of multiple molecular<br>sequences at several levels: Populations, species, clades, communities. These<br>biologists address questions relative to the evolutionary relationships among<br>these sequences, as well as the evolutionary forces structuring biodiversity at<br>different scales. The objectives are: (i) to learn the theorical bases<br> [...] Soledad De Esteban Trivigno 2014-07-08T17:31:48+02:00 2014-07-08T17:31:48+02:00 Course Modelling Dynamic Systems in Biology, Barcelona, Spain. https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AQUA-GENETICS;e5aaf2da.1407 Dear Colleagues,<br><br>Registration is open for the course "MODELLING DINAMICS IN BIOLOGY. FROM HISTORY<br>TO PRACTICAL EXAMPLES", January 19-22, 2015. 28 hours on-site.<br><br>Instructors: Dr. Andreea Munteanu (CGR, Spain) and Dr. Carlos Rodr\ufffd\ufffdguez-Caso<br>(Universidad Pompeu Fabra, Spain)<br><br>Place: Premises of Sabadell of the Institut Catal\ufffd\ufffd de Paleontologia Miquel<br>Crusafont, Sabadell, Barcelona (Spain)<br><br>The current course will present an overview of systems biology with emphasis on<br>the necessity, uses and pitfalls of dynamical modelling in biology. It<br>introduces the required language and philosophy for a smooth and fruitful<br>collaboration between life scientists and theoreticians (i.e. mathematicians,<br>physicists, computer scientists). The main [...]
